gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Components.ViewControls
Class ControlManager

java.lang.Object
  gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Components.ViewControls.ControlManager

public class ControlManager
extends java.lang.Object

This class allows control values for similar controls to be shared. Controls are registered under a category key. All controls under a key maintain a consistent value, when one is altered, all are altered. This class has a graphical display which consists of a copy of the first control added under each key. The viewer may chose not to use this display if displaying all shared controls is desired. Because this class is intended to be a singleton, use getInstance() to get the control manager. No other constructors are provided.

Method Detail

getInstance

public static ControlManager getInstance()
This method will prevent multiple instances of the ControlManager from existing. If one exists, return the reference to it. Otherwise create a new instance.

Returns:
A single instance of the ControlManager.

registerControl

public boolean registerControl(ViewControl vc)
This method will register a control with the ControlManager. Upon registering, the newly registered control value will be set to match any controls also registered under that key. All controls registered under the same key will be linked together, when one changes, all change. If a control has already been registered, it will not be registered a second time.

Parameters:
vc - The control that is being shared and linked to similar controls.
Returns:
Returns true if registration is successful, false if not successful.

unregisterControl

public boolean unregisterControl(ViewControl vc)
This method will unregister a previously registered control. The net effect is that vc will no longer be shared or associated with other controls.

Parameters:
vc - The ViewControl being registered.
Returns:
True if found and unregistered, false if not found.

getControlCount

public int getControlCount(java.lang.String key)
Get the number of controls registered under the specified key. If key is not found, -1 is returned.

Parameters:
key - The category that the controls are grouped under.
Returns:
The number of controls associated with the specified key. If the key is not found, -1 is returned.

getKeyCount

public int getKeyCount()
Get the number of keys (categories) registered with the ControlManager.

Returns:
Number of registered keys.

getRegisteredKeys

public java.lang.String[] getRegisteredKeys()
Get the list of registered keys. The array of keys is NOT arranged in a certain order, do not use in order-dependent operations.

Returns:
Returns the list of registered keys.

getSharedControlsUI

public javax.swing.JPanel getSharedControlsUI()
Get a graphical collection of shared controls displayed in a single panel. As controls are registered and unregistered, the panel adds and removes expired controls. All controls displayed are copies, allowing for multiple display instances of the "same" control. Only a copy of the first registered control for each key is displayed by this panel.

Returns:
Graphical collection of shared controls displayed in a single column.

makeManagerTestWindow

public static javax.swing.JFrame makeManagerTestWindow(ViewControl[] controls)
This method provides a window to test the linking of ViewControls. Use this in the testing of ViewControl.setControlValue() and ViewControl.setControlValue().

Parameters:
controls - - ViewControls to be displayed in the JFrame.
Returns:
A JFrame containing all of the controls plus a ControlCheckbox to toggle linking of controls.

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
For testing purposes only...

Parameters:
args - Input parameters are ignored.
